      • executeGraphSync

        public IAuthorityProxy.RunStatus executeGraphSync(TransformationGraph graph,
                                         GraphRuntimeContext givenRuntimeContext,
                                         java.lang.Long timeout)
                                           throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Description copied from class: IAuthorityProxy
        Executes graph synchronously. Thus it waits until the graph is finished or until the timeout expires. If the graph isn't finished until timeout, it's aborted.
        Specified by:
        executeGraphSync in class IAuthorityProxy
        Parameters:
        graph - - ETL transformation graph to execute
        timeout - - If it's null, there is no time limit
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if the thread is interrupted while waiting for final event

                               int recordLength)

      • assignFilePortion

        public FileConstrains assignFilePortion(java.lang.String componentId,
                               java.lang.String fileURL,
                               java.nio.channels.SeekableByteChannel channel,
                               byte[] recordDelimiter)
                                 throws java.io.IOException
        Description copied from class: IAuthorityProxy
        Assigns proper portion of a file to current cluster node. It is used mainly by ParallelReader, which is able to read just pre-defined part of file. Null is returned if the whole file should be processed. This functionality makes available that each cluster node can process different part of a single file.
        Specified by:
        assignFilePortion in class IAuthorityProxy
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        See Also:
        FileConstrains}, ParallelReader}

      • getRunStatus

        public IAuthorityProxy.RunStatus getRunStatus(long runId,
                                     java.util.List<TrackingEvent> trackingEvents,
                                     java.lang.Long timeout)
        Description copied from class: IAuthorityProxy
        This method is used for tracking a running graphs. For already finished graphs this method returns final run status (tracking info included) of the graph.
        Specified by:
        getRunStatus in class IAuthorityProxy
        Parameters:
        runId - run identifier of graph, which is point of interest
        trackingEvents - list of tracking events, which are requested or null if current RunStatus is requested
        timeout - maximum milliseconds to wait for requested tracking events, in case trackingEvents is null, this parameter is ignored, method is not blocking anyway
        Returns:
        running information of the graph by specified event

      • killJob

        public java.util.List<IAuthorityProxy.RunStatus> killJob(long runId,
                                                boolean recursive)
        Description copied from class: IAuthorityProxy
        Ask authority to kill job specified by run identifier. It may be any run, not just child run.
        Specified by:
        killJob in class IAuthorityProxy
        Parameters:
        runId - job to kill
        recursive - - true if daemon children jobs should be killed as well
        Returns:
        List of killed jobs; Specified job must be included in the list, however it's possible that it's not accessible. E.g. when it's not running any more and it's not persistent. Exception is thrown in such case. List also may contain children jobs killed, but it doesn't contain children jobs finished/failed/killed before.

      • newTempFile

        public java.io.File newTempFile(java.lang.String label,
                       java.lang.String suffix,
                       int allocationHint)
                         throws TempFileCreationException
        Description copied from class: IAuthorityProxy

        Provides new temporary file for graph execution. This method and IAuthorityProxy.newTempFile() are the standard way how a component gets temporary file for them to be managed in common way. Common management allows cleanup of obsolete temporary files in cause of e. g. graph failure.

        These methods obsolete File.createTempFile(String, String) method in whole CloverETL Engine.

        There can be multiple temporary file locations, mainly in server environment. TemporaryFileProvider can choose a random one or uses given hint to determine the right one. Hint can be used e. g. for cycling over all available locations to maximize throughput of a component that utilizes massive IO parallelism (e. g. FastSort). More precisely, if there are n temp. file locations and user specified hint m, location with index m % n is chosen (% represents modular division).

        If it is not possible to create temporary file in some location (e. g. disk full), next location is chosen.

        Client is able to specify label of temp file. Label is used as a part of file name for better identification (e. g. component name, temp purpose...).

        Specified by:
        newTempFile in class IAuthorityProxy
        Parameters:
        label - substring of desired temp. file name; may be null if no special label is desired
        allocationHint - hint to chose temp. file location if more are present; -1 for random allocation
        Returns:
        created temporary file
        Throws:
        TempFileCreationException

      • newTempDir

        public java.io.File newTempDir(java.lang.String label,

                        throws TempFileCreationException

      • getNextTokenIdFromParentJob

        public long getNextTokenIdFromParentJob()
        Description copied from class: IAuthorityProxy
